intro: Isotropis foliosa, commonly known as the leafy isotropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
